headline: Endangered Democratic senators propose suspension of federal gas tax
author: Dave Boyer
sentences:
Ms. Hassan said lawmakers “need to continue to think creatively about how we can find new ways to bring down costs, and this bill would do exactly that, making a tangible difference for workers and families.”
Co-sponsors of the bill include Democratic Sens.

“Arizonans are paying some of the highest prices for gas we have seen in years and it’s putting a strain on families who need to fill up the tank to get to work and school,” Mr. Kelly said in a statement.
Last year, a bipartisan group of lawmakers working with the White House on a $1 trillion infrastructure plan even toyed with the idea of indexing the gas tax to keep up with inflation.
Two Democratic senators facing tough reelection contests proposed Wednesday to suspend the federal gas tax for the rest of the year to help consumers struggling with high fuel prices.
The proposal comes as Republicans are blaming the Biden administration and Democrats for inflation that hit a 40-year high in December.
Maggie Hassan of New Hampshire and Mark Kelly of Arizona, would suspend the 18.4-cents-per-gallon federal gas tax through Jan. 1.
Democrats traditionally oppose plans to lower the federal gas tax, which helps to pay for road repairs and transit systems.
The average price of gas nationally has reached about $3.45 per gallon, according to the automobile owners club AAA.
Catherine Cortez Masto of Nevada and Raphael Warnock of Georgia, who are also up for reelection in November.
In 2019, the gas tax and a 24.4-cent-per-gallon tax on diesel fuel raised about $36.5 billion.
The legislation isn’t expected to gain enough support to pass.
And gas prices typically rise in summer as demand increases.
The Gas Prices Relief Act, introduced by Sens.
The gas tax was last increased in 1993.
